text:
for now just running `autoconf` produces following output:
```<http://configure.ac:283|configure.ac:283>: error: possibly undefined macro: AM_CONDITIONAL
      If this token and others are legitimate, please use m4_pattern_allow.
      See the Autoconf documentation.
<http://configure.ac:874|configure.ac:874>: error: possibly undefined macro: AC_DISABLE_STATIC
<http://configure.ac:2224|configure.ac:2224>: error: possibly undefined macro: AM_LANGINFO_CODESET
<http://configure.ac:2880|configure.ac:2880>: error: possibly undefined macro: AM_NLS
<http://configure.ac:2884|configure.ac:2884>: error: possibly undefined macro: AM_GNU_GETTEXT_VERSION
<http://configure.ac:2885|configure.ac:2885>: error: possibly undefined macro: AM_GNU_GETTEXT```
I need to postpone playing with autoconf for later (this tool is new to me) as I planned to do sth else but I’m curious how `configure` script is generated for R.
